commit.message: Review feedback, etc. Cleaned up some comments and TODO's.
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

guarantees to asserts (non-production), and warnings (production);
review feedback.
jcheck: tab
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

a const, some assertions, and avoid redundant scans for on-objArrays
that straddle across card clusters (sic).

A couple of guarantees to catch a pesky assert that's occasionally
triggering.
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan
More const safety, some asserts, some comments.
Change type of loop variable to signed to allow correct termination for the case when start_card_index is 0. Nominal check for overflow when using signed type for card index.

Fix the direction of an address comparison, add a couple of assertions,
and elaborate some comments. Passes heap verification handily now.

Fixes related to tams logic and iteration, block_start backwards walk
loop, etc. from review feedback from @kdnilsen.

More const safety, & elaboration of some comments.

Clean up & refine comments; rename a variable or two; add a couple of
assertion checks.

Correct tracking of oldest address scanned; relax an overly strong
assertion.
const some methods.
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

Conditional compilation flag to deal with "always imprecise" as well as
"sometimes imprecise" (default).
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan
- fix an error introduced in last set of mods
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

- some log_info -> log_debug
- additional documentation comments
- object on dirty card should be scanned, even if the header might
  not be dirty. This code needs to be optimized further. Also need
  to check current understanding of card-marking code generated by
  compiler (assumed precise) and by interpreter (assumed imprecise).
  Not assuming precise barriers by compiler was leading to issues.

- some consts
- which elicited a sneaky bug, now fixed
- more assertions
Place assert at the right place.
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

Fixed another couple of bugs; scanner parses all of a non-array object
whose header is on a dirty card, even if object extends past the end of
the range. Should probably assert that such an object can't extend past
the end of the range (although it can past the end of the last dirty card in
the range).

Elaborate some comments; take care of some todo's, including addition of
additional asserts/checking, and simplification of mr-based scanning.
Still need to work through oop_iterate(cl, mr), make sure mr is
sufficiently fine, respects end_of_addr, and that use of mr-based
version isn't more expensive. (I suspect it might be and I'll likely
have to revise this version a bit and take a slightly different tack to
deal with objects that go past end of mr -- by treating arrays and
return from block_start specially.)

Walk and scan objects above tams; assert that slice being processed is in
a single region.

CardValue in place of unint8_t, etc.
Enable an assert that had been disabled (need to check its provenance).
jcheck clean
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

First complete implementation of ShenandoahCardCluster::block_start().
Still need to put in some stats collection and assess performance.
Will still need to revisit process_clusters() and make sure most
correctness todo's are taken care of.

Runs a few GC cycles with SPECjbb2015, but soon enough fails a rem set
verification; so there are definitely correctness issues lurking still,
as well as performance issues to address.

Start imp of block_start() for _scc. Needs more work, stubbed out with
guarantee(false) for now.

Some comments; also renamed has_object() to starts_object(), a purely
syntactic change.

Fix an off-by-one (too many) error in counting cards for card-stats.
Still running into an assertion, finding _scc reports no objects on
a dirty card, usually coinciding with the first card in a cluster set.
(Or so it seemed in the cases where I checked.) Have temporarily
disabled card clearing, but need to see where cards are being set and
cleared by the GC work.
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

First cut of improved scanner; needs debugging & performance
measurements.
Stash at break: no substantive change.
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

Temporary stashing of work in progress. No substantive changes, just
minor const's, and a few documentation comment changes.
Some more cruft removal.

Remove some redundnant variables & parms; note some thoughts as todo's.
No substantive changes to main (triply nested) work loop yet.
Merge branch 'JVM-1264' into rs_scan
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264
A couple of changes based on review feedback.
Reword some code comments for greater clarity.
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan
Minor comment updates.
Merge branch 'JVM-1264' into rs_scan
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264-dependent
Merge branch 'master' into rs_scan

Add a previously missed ticket#. Doing it here rather than in parent to
avoid an otherwise unnecessary re-review touchpoint.
Merge branch 'stats_merge' into JVM-1264-dependent
Merge branch 'master' into stats_merge
jcheck space fix
Fix compiler error on windows.
Fix some tier1 tests.
Remove an unnecessary include, fix some type incorrectness.
Merge branch 'JVM-1264' into JVM-1264-dependent
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264

Tested and fixed some bugs; printing frequency of cumulative stats controlled by
command-line option.

Ready for review.

Remove stubs (guarantee/false).
This still needs formal work on merging decayed stats, but is OK to
ignore for now because no one currently uses the decayed stats. The
non-decayed stats also need further review and correction. So this is
still an interim checkin.

To do:
-- print final summary at exit; consider if periodic cumulative summary might be
useful as well (Every major collection cycles?)
-- check correctness of merged data (ignoring decayed statistics for
now)
Merge branch 'stats_merge' into JVM-1264
jcheck clean

Separated out stats for scan_rs and update_refs
Still need to carry cumulative stats, and merge stats from each round
into cumulative.The latter needs a "merge" method in NumberSeq, which
will be a separate PR.
Extract ShenandoahCardStats into its own {.h,.c}pp files.
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264

NOT_PRODUCT() for the stats allocation. Although the stats colelction
calls were inlined and constant-folded away by the comoiler, the
allocation was not removed, go figure. Thus it made sense to remove them
all via NOT_PRODUCT(). I might revisit this in later iterations as I
work on the card-scan loop itself, but for now this is sufficient.
Moved some more methods into non-product mode.
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264

Card stats only in non-product mode (until impact of stats collection is
reduce).
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264
jcheck whitespace fixes.
Fix card_stats() so it doesn't crash when card stats aren't enabled.
Fix comment.

Don't allocate stats arrays if not enabled. Should we decide we want
this to be a "manageable", we will have to slightly rework this.
Disable card stats printing when disabled

Remove compile time preprocesor option.
Strengthen some asserts.
Fix a type issue in a couple of variables.
Fix a copy-and-paste error in previous commit which was messing up stats
(and trigerred an assert).

Protect card stats with a diagnostic shenandoah flag disabled by
default. The resulting performance impact when disabled is near zero.

The next commit will remove the compile time options which are now
rendered unnecessary.

Fix typo in spelling of preprocessor option name.
Fix a boundary condition in comparison for NumberSeq that was triggering
an assert. Re-enable asserts that had previously been disabled.

Fix build when card stats are disabled.

Might make sense to extract card stats class itself into a separate
file to reduce the syntactic footprint of card stats code.
Enum to replaces hard-wired constants, up to 11, for indexing the rows of card stats.

Need ParallelGCThreads worth of stats array because degenerate GCs use
up to that many threads for the otherwise concurrent phases.

Local stats updates to avoid unnecessary synchronization.
Allocate only ConcGCThreads worth of stats array, but may need to extend
back to ParallelGCThreads again as I suspect that sometimes more threads
are used for process_clusters(). Worker 0 is overloaded for work done
simgle threaded.

Still need to redo careful measurements of stat overhead following local
stats updates and no synchronization. Stats code is still protected by a
compile time flag in source.
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264

Remove the no longer used "worker_id"; we might need to reintroduce it
or similar at an appropriate place should we decide to reduce locking
for stats updates. Coarse locking or no locking may work because shared
stats are updated only at the end of each cluster.

Complete instrumentation, protected by preprocessor flag.
Prints quartiles of various card stats per chunk (cluster).
Tested with prepocessor flag enabled and disabled.

JVM-1264: extract stats maintenance into ShenandoahCardStats & formalize
interface API. Arrange for stats code to be elided via pre-processor
switch.

We still need to accumulate stats in a distribution (histogram) for
frequency distribution of clean and dirty cards in a cluster.
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264
Fix merge error.
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264

Fix configuration of the number of workers used in concurrent remembered
set scanning so we based off of ConcGCThreads, rather than off of
ParallelGCThreads.
Refine metrics, add additional instrumentation sites.
Card stats can be locally allocated; related cleanups.
Merge branch 'master' into JVM-1264
Fix a bug in instrumentation & assertions.

Add basic logging of instrumentation data. Correct some
instrumentation code and related assertions.

The beginnings of instrumentation for card statistics for GenShen.
Some updates to comments related to card scanning.
Merge branch 'openjdk:master' into JVM-1264

Leave cancel/yield in ShenandoahScanRemeberedTask::do_work() disabled,
as the change to where the yield is performed does not fix the crashing
behaviour. A ticket now tracks the issue.

Fix an issue with cacnellation in
ShenandoahScanRememberedTask::do_work(() where an item of work was
pulled off the worklist, but dropped on the floor without first
processing it before returning.

Removed unused process_region() methods in ShenandoahScanRemembered, et
al.

Elaborate some comments; remove unused overreach related methods and commets. These will not be needed as a result of upcoming changes to process_clusters() where we will treat objects that start cards in a more uniform fashion in-line with the scan of dirty cards in the cluster being processed.
Merge branch 'master' into stats_merge
Safety tests for decayed stats, until implemented.
gtest for merge.
Vanilla merge test for ShenandoahNumberSeq; needs to be extended some.

Changes based on experience with uses in RS scan stats.
Fixed some bugs.

-- We still need to implement a few vanilla tests for the merge method.
-- Planning to defer the work on decayed stats (which will be delivered
separately in a lower-priority sibling ticket)
Merge branch 'master' into stats_merge

More merge() implementation.
-- Need to think about merge of decaying stats in AbsSeq.
-- Need to add tests.

Interim checkin of code w/beginnings of merge() support. Some
implementations are still stubbed out and need to be written.
First cut at merge. More changes to come. May not build yet.
